main event: On the night of November 8, 1965, an engineer observed a peculiar light in the sky above Pocatello, Idaho, from approximately 7:00 PM to 9:00 PM.
interesting points: The light was bright and moved in a northerly direction at a high rate of speed before changing course westward., The light was luminescent and fixed in position during the observation period., At times, it appeared surrounded by a reddish-orange glow or halo., Visibility conditions were excellent with no cloud cover or haze., The observer was a professional engineer familiar with celestial objects and concluded it was of an unidentified nature.
sighted object: a bright luminescent light in the sky
witness description: a professional engineer employed by the United States Geological Survey
